titleStmt.title: A pacquet of popish delusions, false miracles, and lying wonders together with many grand divisions among papists: far exceeding both in quality and quantity those among Protestants: notwithstanding their seeming unity. Exposed to the shame of popery. Whereunto is added the papists dissentions from the Protestant: with (that, the enemy so much glorys-in, viz.) the differences of the Protestants among themselves. And, a fearful caution to apostatizing Protestants. By Mercurius Hibernicus.
titleStmt.author: Mercurius, Hibernicus.

notesStmt.note: Half-title reads "Popish delusions, and divisions." with the words "delusions, and divisions." bracketed together.
Imperfect; pages cropped with loss of numbering.
Errata at the foot of E2r.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
